title: How to Install and Customize an Xmb Forum

steps.title: If you already have the forum package on your computer, skip this step and the next.
steps.content: If you already have the forum package on your computer, skip this step and the next. Otherwise, download the forum software. Go to the forum site directly in your internet browser. At the top left corner, just beneath the Download XMB title, select the option presented, it is the latest version of the forum.

steps.title: Depending on your browser, you should be getting a notification of a download.
steps.content: Depending on your browser, you should be getting a notification of a download. Choose the option to save the file, desktop is recommended. Remember where you saved it, you will need it shortly.

steps.title: If you have already created a database for your forum, skip this step.
steps.content: If you have already created a database for your forum, skip this step. Go to your server’s control panel and to the database section. Create a new database, add a user with full privileges to the database, and remember the database name, and your username and password that can access it.

steps.title: Extract the contents of the forum zip file to a location on your hard drive.
steps.content: Extract the contents of the forum zip file to a location on your hard drive. Open your FTP client and connect to your server. Create a new directory in your server where you wish the forum to be installed. Locate the forum files on your hard disk and open the main folder and then open the files folder, transfer all the files and folders within it to the new directory. This will take a few minutes.

steps.title: XMB Installer
steps.content: In your internet browser, go to your domain’s forum folder, and add install/ at the end. It should look similar to the following, obviously your actual domainname and folder name will be displayed: http://www.domainname.com/forumfolder/install/. You should now be at a page titled XMB Installer .

steps.title: Follow the instructions on the webpage until you have installed everything and end up on a page saying Installation Complete.
steps.content: Follow the instructions on the webpage until you have installed everything and end up on a page saying Installation Complete . If the installation did not work, check your database settings and confirm the location of your forum on the server. [1] X Research source

steps.title: In the upper right corner of the forum, you should see the options Login and Register.
steps.content: In the upper right corner of the forum, you should see the options Login and Register . Login with the information you provided in the installation steps. Now at the same corner you should see a few more options, click on Administration Panel . This page will be where you make any administrative changes to your forum, see image 2.

steps.title: In the Administrative Panel, under the title General, select the option Settings.
steps.content: In the Administrative Panel, under the title General, select the option Settings. The Board Rules show up as the first step of a new user registration, as well at in the top menu bar of your forum. Additional Languages can be downloaded from the XMB website, as can themes [2] X Research source and modifications. [3] X Research source For the Optional Fields , selecting on will simply add optional fields for the user to enter when they register to your forum. The News in NewsTicker is the scrolling text that is shown at the top of your forum’s index page, modify it to display any text you wish.

steps.title: In the Administrative Panel, under the title Look & Feel, select the option Themes.
steps.content: In the Administrative Panel, under the title Look & Feel, select the option Themes. Select New Theme in bold, above and to the left of the Submit Changes button. Fill out the values as you wish to make your own custom theme, trial and error by saving and looking at the index page works well. Remember that the colour values are either in words or hexadecimal values.

steps.title: In the Administrative Panel, under the title Forums, select the option Forums.
steps.content: In the Administrative Panel, under the title Forums, select the option Forums. A Category is the title for a group of forums. A Forum is the place where threads are posted. A Sub-board is a division within a forum, where other threads can be posted.

steps.title: To make a new category, click on the text field that reads New Category and type in the name you wish to give it, for example Welcome Center.
steps.content: To make a new category, click on the text field that reads New Category and type in the name you wish to give it, for example Welcome Center .

steps.title: To make a new forum, click on the text field that reads New Forum and type in the name you wish to give it, for example Introductions.
steps.content: To make a new forum, click on the text field that reads New Forum and type in the name you wish to give it, for example Introductions . In the dropdown menu to the right of the On/Off dropdown menu, select which category you want your new forum to be listed under. Making a sub-board works the same way as making a new forum.

steps.title: In the Order box, type the number in which you want the function to appear comparatively to the other categories, forums in the same category, or sub-boards in the same forum.
steps.content: In the Order box, type the number in which you want the function to appear comparatively to the other categories, forums in the same category, or sub-boards in the same forum. To delete something, select the checkbox to its left, and select Submit Changes . Remember to hit Submit Changes every time you fill out a form to have the changes take effect, view image 3 for the mentioned examples.
